dpul.title: Widget - Search Results: Research needed. not quite sure how this is supposed to look/function

comments.body:
Once you've created a "saved search" and published it as a browse category by giving it a checkmark in the dashboard > browse admin area, you can present the search results on the exhibit home page.

In my testing it works as expected for all search results views. There are some small display issues on some search result views; created separate issues for those (#1105 and #1106)

dpul.title: widgets - border missing around text box

comments.body:
@hackartisan Tested and when you click /activate it, the blue box is around it for me as well. the non active box around the text form in DPUL prod is barely visible (but there) until activated. Question, perhaps for @sdellis : what are your thoughts from a UX perspective.  current DPUL prod unactive box below:
![Screen Shot 2021-10-13 at 10 15 13 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45043014/137151183-603ec2e4-6d62-466b-a10c-ac156ff25045.png)

dpul.title: Make item embed show up
Widget - Item embed: Will not show selected item and selection of viewing text on right not functioning as expected.

comments.body: the item embed is always malfuncitoning/throwing up errors in DPUL prod. and so I/others don't use it. But I do think it should be functional for an important reason:   It would be wonderful to use the item embed feature to create exhibits in the order that curators want individuals to experience them in for milberg exhibitions companions, and i think this might be the better way to do it versus alternatives discussed in the past.  Thoughts?
What are the options for increasing thumbnail size? this would be a win, considering it has been an ask by several individuals.
I've confirmed that all the same data is there in page content database field as we have in prod. So the problem is on the view side.

dpul.title: Markdown images don't have a max width

comments.body: @tpendragon  - if it helps, those were all added to the site via html in the text widget and  I know where it has been used in all exhibitions. I would assume all items added in this way are inconsistent in 3.0 staging.
Ohh, you're uploading items and not displaying them just as a way to have them be uploaded, and then using markdown to link to them. That's clever.
yup :) it was a way to get them large enough for folks to view, in the order they want, while still linking them to the viewer or to the lending institution. It worked well

dpul.title: Updates primary and secondary button styles and colors
Error during failsafe response: undefined method `field_enabled?' for class `PagesController'

comments.body:
In Figgy, the collection had an invalid slug. There is a validation about that, but the data somehow made it in. The malformed slug "Lecture Notes Collection AC052" was used as an exhibit id in DPUL which caused a Solr error.

Fix was to change the slug to AC052 in Figgy. Did a test in DPUL locally, and it worked. 

![Screen Shot 2021-10-13 at 4 11 56 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/784196/137213625-c142c92c-817b-4910-a5f7-d92c14df84f4.png)
